snippet: Estelle Cooper, former administrator for Flushing Meadows-Corona Park in Queens, was indicted in the theft of more than $50,000 from Unisphere Inc.
abstract: Estelle Cooper, former administrator for Flushing Meadows-Corona Park in Queens, is indicted on charges that she stole more than $50,000 from Unisphere Inc, a nonprofit organization she founded in 2003; Cooper faces up to 15 years in prison if convicted.
lead_paragraph: Estelle Cooper, former administrator for Flushing Meadows-Corona Park in Queens, was indicted in the theft of more than $50,000 from Unisphere Inc.

headline.seo: Estelle Cooper, Former Queens Park Administrator, Is Charged With Stealing
headline.main: Former Queens Park Official Is Charged With Stealing
headline.print_headline: Former Official In Parks Dept. Is Charged With Stealing
